instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message:
Liquid damaged. Customer previously took it to another shop so the board is pretty clean. Looks like bios may have been fucked with. Fan spins only with I/O board disconnected. <SIGNAL>PVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL> is 1.695V. USB mouse works from other USB port. Thanks have a good one.

* Sorry. I meant I/O board cable disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message: Does it do the 3 times on/off? Can you do a PRAM reset from external keyboard? Caps lock working if you hold down ALT to go into boot menu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message: No... Only does on/off 2 times then fan goes high. Cannot PRAM nor Caps Lock using external KB. Thanks man.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message: Probably BIOS issue or the termination resistors/traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message: OK. Bought BIOS chip from ebay to test. Also bought a programmer from Ali. When I confirm it is BIOS issue and programmer comes in can you help with new BIOS flash? Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message: I doubt the chip itself will be bad. Traces/resistors are the first suspect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message: Hey Duke. I have checked traces and replaced BIOS. Still nothing. I have 3v3 V on 1,2,3,7 and 8 of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. Thanks man.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime, no video
threads.message: As this is a pre-fucked board it can be anything. Check for knocked off components, crap under SMC, corroded traces/resistors. There is no magic to pre-fucked garbage.
